Using the FlashFX Reader and Datalight Loader

Send comments on this topic.
This section describes using FlashFX Tera in a boot loader environment to allow a file (typically an OS image) to be loaded off a FAT or Reliance formatted FlashFX disk.

Overview

Many embedded systems that use flash storage divide the flash array into two (or more) sections, allotting one of those sections for storing the OS image, and the other for use as a disk drive, made possible with software such as FlashFX. Perhaps yet another section will be allotted to storing configuration parameters.

Using this style of divided flash array has several disadvantages:

  • The divisions must be decided when the device is designed, and it cannot typically be changed after-the-fact. This means that the system designer must set aside enough space in each portion of the array to allow for future expansion.
  • The division boundaries must typically fall on erase zone boundaries which limits flexibility and results in wasted space. For example a portion of the array used for configuration parameters might require very little space, however erase zone boundaries on modern flash parts are often 256KB or larger.
  • The flash divisions provide no fail-safe mechanism in the event of an interrupted image update.
FlashFX Tera is designed to be flexible and allow a flash array to contain a single disk image that can serve all three purposes.

The FlashFX Loader is a key piece of this functionality. The FlashFX Loader provides a simplified interface that allows FlashFX to be easily integrated into a boot loader.

The FlashFX Loader consists of two pieces, the first of which is the Datalight Loader, which provides the high-level functionality, and the second is the FlashFX I/O module, which plugs in as a back-end to the Datalight Loader.

The Datalight Loader is documented in the DCL documentation, and it is highly recommended that you familiarize yourself with that documentation before proceeding.

Note -- Before undertaking the task of integrating and using the FlashFX Loader, the general FlashFX device driver functionality must be implemented and fully functional. FlashFX Loader work would typically be one of the final steps in the development process.

Implementing FlashFX as a Datalight Loader I/O Module

The FlashFX Loader provides a simple interface that allows FlashFX to be initialized and a single file loaded into memory, from a FAT or Reliance formatted disk partition.

FlashFX Tera includes an implementation of the Loader I/O interface which allows the Loader to mount disks that are formatted with FlashFX. The code is automatically compiled and linked into FlashFX.lib when you build for the Loader OS. To use the FlashFX I/O layer in your boot application code, follow these steps:

1 - Include fxreaderio.h
2 - Allocate a DCLREADERIO structure
3 - Call FfxReaderIoCreate with a pointer to the DCLREADERIO structure
4 - Call DclLoaderCreate() with a pointer to the DCLREADERIO structure
5 - After the boot application has finished reading the disk, call DclLoaderDestroy() and FxReaderIoDestroy.

Here's an example 

        +---------------------------------------------------------------------+
        |                                                                     |
        |  #include <bootstuff.h> /* fictional environment specific header */ |
        |  #include <dcl.h>                                                   |
        |  #include <dlloader.h>                                              |
        |  #include <dlreaderio.h>                                            |
        |  #include <fxreaderio.h>                                            |
        |                                                                     |
        |  #define MY_FLASHFX_BOOT_DEVICENUM 0                                |
        |  #define MY_FLASHFX_BOOT_DISKNUM 0                                  |
        |  #define MY_FLASHFX_BOOT_PARTNUM 0                                  |
        |                                                                     |
        |  void main(void)                                                    |
        |  {                                                                  |
        |      DCLREADERIO     sFlashFXIO;                                    |
        |      DCLSTATUS       dclStat;                                       |
        |      DCLLOADERHANDLE hLoader;                                       |
        |                                                                     |
        |      /*  Create an instance of the FlashFX I/O layer                |
        |      */                                                             |
        |      dclStat = FfxReaderIoCreate(                                   |
        |                             MY_FLASHFX_BOOT_DEVICENUM,              |
        |                             MY_FLASHFX_BOOT_DISKNUM,                |
        |                             MY_FLASHFX_BOOT_PARTNUM,                |
        |                             &sFlashFXIO);                           |
        |      if(dclStat != DCLSTAT_SUCCESS)                                 |
        |      {                                                              |
        |          /*  An unexpected error occurred.                          |
        |          */                                                         |
        |          printf ("Failed to mount boot device\n");                  |
        |          BootApp_HALT;                                            |
        |      }                                                              |
        |                                                                     |
        |      /* Initialize the loader                                       |
        |      */                                                             |
        |      hLoader = DclLoaderCreate(&sFlashFXIO);                        |
        |      if(!hLoader)                                                   |
        |      {                                                              |
        |          printf("Failed to mount file system.\n");                  |
        |                                                                     |
        |          BootApp_HALT;                                            |
        |      }                                                              |
        |                                                                     |
        |      /* Do device-specific boot tasks                               |
        |      */                                                             |
        |      BootApp_LoadOS(hLoader);                                       |
        |                                                                     |
        |      /*  Deinitialize the Loader and the FlashFX I/O layer.         |
        |      */                                                             |
        |      DclLoaderDestroy(hLoader);                                     |
        |      sFlashFXIO.fnIoDestroy(&sFlashFXIO);                           |
        |                                                                     |
        |      /*  Start the operating system                                 |
        |      */                                                             |
        |      BootApp_StartOS;                                             |
        |  }                                                                  |
        |                                                                     |
        +---------------------------------------------------------------------+
